brief_summary.textblock:
The functionality and reproducibility of pulse wave analysis is investigated in 20 type 2
      diabetic patients who had two 24 hour measurements performed within one week with the
      Arteriograph24 equipment.

clinical_study.brief_title: Twentyfour Ambulatory Pulse Wave Velocity and Central Augmentation Index in Type 2 Diabetes

detailed_description.textblock:
Arteriograph24 is a new monitor for measuring ambulatory blood pressure and additional
      performing brachial cuff based on analysis of a suprasystolic pulse wave.

      The study aim to test the feasibility of ambulatory pulse wave analysis every twenty minute
      (the fraction of missed measurements)and the reprodicility of pulse wave velocity and
      central augmentation index in type 2 diabetic patients. In addition we will explore the
      relation between diurnal variation of brachial blood pressure, central blood pressure and
      pulse wave velocity.

      20  type 2 diabetic patients will have 24h ambulatory blood pressure performed twice with an
      interval of one week.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Type 2 diabetes

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Atrial fibrillation

study_pop.textblock: Type 2 diabetes patients recruited from out patient clinic

facility.name: Medical department, Diagnostic Center, Regional Hospital Silkeborg

other_outcome.description: brachial blood pressure, central blood pressure and pulse wava velocity is measured evrey twenty minutes and averaged for day time and night time. the relative reduction at nioght for the parameters are calculated
other_outcome.measure: Diurnal variation of brachial blood pressure, central blood pressure and pulse wave velocity
other_outcome.time_frame: Measured two times with an interval of one week

overall_official.affiliation: Medical department, Diagnostic Center, Regional Hospital Silkeborg, Denmark

primary_outcome.description: Measurements of ambulatory blood pressure and pulse wave analysis is performed every twenty minute. The fraction of missed measurements of pulse wave analysis during day time and night time analysis is the final outcome
primary_outcome.measure: Fraction of missed pulse wave analysis
primary_outcome.time_frame: Meaured two times with an interval of one week

secondary_outcome.description: Reproducibility of pulse wave velocity, Central systolic blood pressure and central augmentation index for 24 hour, day and night
secondary_outcome.measure: Reproducibility of pulse wave analysis parameters
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Measured two times with an interval of one week
